metadata.Title: CVE-2020-36329 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in libwebp in versions before 1.0.1. A use-after-free was found due to a thread being killed too early. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as well as system availability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-36329` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwebp5 - 0.4.0-4ubuntu0.1~esm1
libwebpdemux1 - 0.4.0-4ubuntu0.1~esm1
libwebpmux1 - 0.4.0-4ubuntu0.1~esm1
webp - 0.4.0-4ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libwebp package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.4.0-4ubuntu0.1~esm1').
